title: How to remove Google Play music and some other apps - Quora

response.answer_text: You can remove it manually. Quit Google Music Manager.Open the Applications folder → remove Manager.app.Now find and delete all useless service files related to the Google Play Music Manager app which are stored in the Library folder.~/Library/Application Support/Google/MusicManager ~/Library/Google/GoogleSoftwareUpdate/Actives/com.google.musicmanager/ ~/Library/Logs/MusicManager/MusicManagerHelper.log/ ~/Library/Preferences/com.google.musicmanager.plist/ ~/Library/PreferencePanes/MusicManager.prefPane/  Also you should check the following subfolders for the leftovers of Google Music Manager: ~/Library/Caches/~/Library/LaunchAgents~/Library/LaunchDaemons~/Library/StartupItemsThen empty your Trash.

Google Play Music comes factory installed on Android phones and tablets. Why? Google makes Android. You won’t be able to remove it unless you root your device, and afterwards install an app management program like App2SD, which is also useful for a lot of other things.
